title: Mourning the death of Henry David Weissmann, distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  mourning  the  death  of Henry David Weissmann,
distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body  to  pay  tribute  to
citizens  of  the  State  of  New York whose lifework and civic endeavor
served to enhance the quality of life in their communities and the great
State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Henry David Weissmann of Binghamton, New York, died on Decem-
ber 16, 2010, at the age of 74; and
  WHEREAS, Son of Fred and Erna Weissmann,  Henry  David  Weissmann  was
born January 9, 1936, in Mannheim, Germany; and
  WHEREAS,  A  Holocaust  survivor,  Henry  David  Weissmann came to the
United States with his parents when he was four-years old where he  grew
up and built a thriving dairy farm in Harpursville, New York; and
  WHEREAS, Henry David Weissmann distinguished himself in his profession
and  by  his  sincere  dedication  and  substantial  contribution to the
welfare of his community; and
  WHEREAS, Henry David Weissmann served as a  Broome  County  Legislator
from  9th  District and after retiring from farming, he went to work for
Broome County where he served as Manager of Risk and  Insurance,  Deputy
County  Clerk,  Manager of Department of Motor Vehicles, and Director of
Public Works; following retirement in December of 2007,  he  worked  for
Nezuntoz Cafe, where his son, Scott, is an owner; and
  WHEREAS,  Henry  David  Weissmann's  commitment to excellence, and his
spirit of humanity, carried over into all fields of enterprise,  includ-
ing charitable and civic endeavors; and
  WHEREAS, Always active in community affairs, Henry David Weissmann was
the  founding  President  of  Colesville Rotary Club, Past President and
Treasurer of the Broome Tioga Holstein  Club,  member  of  Farm  Bureau,
Member of Afton Sertoma Club, and Member and past Treasurer of Hillcrest
Rotary; and
  WHEREAS, In addition, Henry David Weissmann served for 20 years on the
Board  of  Education  of  Harpursville  Central School; he served on the
Boards of Children's Home of Wyoming  Conference  and  Metro  Interfaith
Housing  and for many years, he and his family enjoyed hosting a variety
of Rotary Exchange Students; he was an ardent fundraiser, whether manag-
ing golf tournaments or  pancake  breakfasts  or  flipping  hotdogs  and
hamburgers for various organizations; and
  WHEREAS,  Henry  David Weissmann loved sports and was quite an athlete
in his day, playing football in college and  coaching  his  children  in
later  years;  his love of sports was honored each year as he, his sons,
and his friends traveled annually to New York City for the NCAA  basket-
ball tournaments; and
  WHEREAS,  Harboring  a  love for Broadway shows, Henry David Weissmann
was a long-time season ticket holder to The Cider Mill;  he  also  loved
entertaining  and  planning  parties;  at  Cayuga  Lake he and his wife,
Carol, enjoyed years of wonderful weekends with their  Stress  Reduction
friends; and
  WHEREAS,  Henry  David  Weismann is predeceased by one son, Denton; in
addition to his loving wife of 51 years, Carol Simons Weissmann,  he  is
also  survived  by  his  children,  Mark, Scott, and Dori, and his eight
grandchildren, Devin, Jennifer, Cara, Ruthie, Elliott, Isaac, Samara and
Maya, as well as one brother-in-law, Ronnie Simons; and
  WHEREAS, Armed with a  humanistic  spirit,  imbued  with  a  sense  of
compassion,  and  comforted  by  a  loving family, Henry David Weissmann
leaves behind a legacy which will long endure the passage  of  time  and

will remain as a comforting memory to all he served and befriended; now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
mourn the death of Henry  David  Weissmann,  distinguished  citizen  and
devoted member of his community; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the family of Henry David Weissmann.
